intro: Thesium rectangulum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thesium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its upright, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense, terminal clusters. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly waxy texture. Thesium rectangulum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
